Airplanes take off by using thrust to push the plane forward on the ground.
An airplane or aeroplane is a powered, fixed-wing aircraft that is propelled forward by thrust from a jet engine, propeller or rocket engine.
Planes take off from airports.
A jet aircraft (or simply jet) is an aircraft (nearly always a fixed-wing aircraft) propelled by jet engines (jet propulsion).
Aircraft can be categorized in a number of ways. One way is by the type of flight. An aircraft can be a glider, a helicopter, a rocket, a balloon, or a jet.
Aircraft can be classified by different ways, such as how they are powered and what they are designed to do.
